David Binetti

Implementing Lean Startup strategy for startups of all sizes.

About

I'm a six-time entrepreneur, speaker, and consultant on Lean Startup strategy and tactics.

My last company, Votizen, leads a chapter in Eric Ries's #1 Bestseller "The Lean Startup." I included Eric, Steve Blank, Sean Parker, Ashton Kutcher, Peter Thiel, and Ron Conway among my investors and was pleased to have lead Votizen to a successful acquisition in 2013.

I've also been on the founding team of five other startups, including QFN.com, which became Quicken.com (Intuit), Arch Rock (acquired by Cisco), and USA.gov (named USA Today's Site of the Year in 2000.)

I received my Bachelors with Highest Honors and General Distinction from UC Berkeley, and my MBA at UCLA where my team received the Deloitte Consulting Award for Top Thesis in the graduating class. I live in San Carlos, CA, with my wife and two daughters.

I am currently consulting for organizations seeking to implement a Lean Startup approach and would love to see if I can help you develop a new product at greatly reduced market risk.

Approach

The Lean Startup methodology is transforming how new products are built and launched. Whether your company is a tech startup or a Fortune 500 corporation you can benefit from this innovative approach to business model development and market risk reduction. I've successfully applied the Lean approach in my own companies as well as for other clients and am confident any organization can benefit from Lean principles.

  • 1. Assessment
  • 2. Baselining
  • 3. Build-Measure-Learn
  • 4. Handoff

Assessment

The assessment stage determines the overall applicability of the Lean Startup approach to the organization. This output is a preliminary recommendation on the appropriateness of using Lean to achieve the client goals.

Learn More

Baselining

Baselining sets the Innovation Accounting framework from which progress will be measured. It is from this data that you'll learn whether it is time to persist in current strategy or pivot to another model.

Learn More

Build-Measure-Learn

The core of the Lean Startup approach is the Build-Measure-Learn cycle. We'll release MVPs, watch the results, and learn from customers to acheive a sustainable and scalable business model.

Learn More

Handoff

Throughout each engagement care is taken to observe proper change management principles so that the Lean Startup approach becomes a permanent part of your organizational culture.

Learn More
